article.headline: Holy Cross 88, Navy 54
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) -- Jave Meade scored 15 points with 7 assists and 6 steals to pace four players in double figures as Holy Cross overpowered Navy 88-54 on Friday night. Holy Cross (8-9, 2-2 Patriot) snapped its two-game losing streak. Jeff Charles scored 12 points for Navy (3-13, 0-4) which lost its fifth straight game. Meade and Kevin Hamilton sparked the Holy Cross defense in the first half. The Crusaders forced Navy into five consecutive turnovers in the first half during an 11-0 run to break the game open early. After Charles scored back-to-back baskets to tie the game 12-12 with 15:52 left in the first half, Meade and Keith Simmons converted back-to-back 3-point field goals. Hamilton and Meade then each made steals that led to scores as Holy Cross surged to a 23-12 lead. Taj Mathews and Kwame Ofori converted 3-pointers to cut the lead to 25-18 with 10-39 left, but Meade then keyed another decisive surge. Meade had 5 points, 2 assists and 2 steals to spark Holy Cross on a 21-5 run over the next six minutes. That gave Holy Cross an insurmountable 46-23 lead. Holy Cross led 48-25 at halftime. Greg Kinsey of Holy Cross nailed a 3-pointer in the opening minute of the second half, igniting another 13-0 run to put the game out of reach.
